title: Network Analyst
content:
POSITION TITLE: Network Analyst
POSITION REPORTS TO: Sr. Manager, IT Infrastructure
POSITION SUMMARY: MLB Network seeks a Network Analyst to work specifically with the Company’s IP network infrastructure, network management systems, wireless infrastructure and remote access systems.
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provide IP network expertise in the maintenance, management, and support of both broadcast and office networks.
Work effectively with senior network engineers on the integration and schematic depiction of communication architectures, topologies, hardware, software, transmission, signaling links and protocols into complete network
Monitor network health, perform system tuning and make recommendations for
Implement and manage daily user network requests, hardware installation, and user
Assist in the evaluation of new products, perform network problem resolution and assist in the development and documentation of technical standards and interface
Provide Tier-2 troubleshooting support working with the user support team and the operations staff to effectively manage and monitor all systems - including contributing to the preparation of technical design and planning documents and creating and maintaining as built documents and troubleshooting guides.
Stay current with system information, changes and
Work with subject matter experts on networking and server projects to improve the end user
Other such duties as

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

A minimum of 4-5 years of hands-on experience in a fast-paced IT In-depth knowledge of end user computers and the network connectivity to them.
Must have experience with IP network connectivity and
Must have experience with Cisco Network environments with up-to-date skills in Cisco Nexus Switches, Cisco UCS, Layer 2 and Layer 3 TCP/IP Routing
Must have experience with wireless networks and remote access.
Knowledge of SAN and NAS storage solutions
Must be detail oriented, meticulous and able to maintain confidentiality.
Must be able to lead small teams, as necessary and possess good interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with team members and outside user
Must have experience with Cisco ISE, AAA, RADIUS, TACACS and 802.1x
Must have experience with common network services, SNMP, Syslog, DNS, NTP, DHCP, AD, etc.
Analyze network performance using various modern telemetry tools and provide root cause analysis, recommendations, guidance and expertise in maintaining the highest level of performance.
Experience with scripting languages (Python, bash, etc.) is preferred.
Exposure to Data Center and virtualization technologies (UCS, VMware ESXi, vSphere, vSAN).
Understanding of the broadcast networking landscape and requirements including 2110 standards.
This position requires a self-motivated individual who can interface with a diverse group of people and situations.
Demonstrate the tact, diplomacy, decisiveness, and superior people skills required in the pressurized environment of live television.
Ability to effectively work and multitask in a rapid-paced 7/24/365 pressurized, live broadcast environment.
This position requires the ability to work independently, prioritize and to be a proactive
Knowledge and experience of customer service
Possess excellent verbal and written communication
Ability to work a flexible schedule as needed, including nights, weekends, and
Must be able to occasionally travel domestically and internationally for multiple days in a row to assist at remote broadcast productions when assigned.
Needs to be highly professional, courteous, organized, and demonstrate initiative and an ability to complete multiple assignments in a timely
Experience in the television, advertising, affiliate sales or production industries is a
Possess the manual dexterity to effectively operate keyboard/mouse on computers, etc.
Possess the visual acuity needed to effectively deliver required work product.
Possess the auditory acuity needed to effectively deliver required work product.
Ability to walk, sit, stand, kneel, bend, twist, and turn for sufficient lengths of time in order to effectively deliver required work product.
Ability to lift up to 50 pounds.

EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in IT / Technical Communications, Broadcast IT or equivalent related experience is preferred.
WORK CLASSIFICATION: Standard: Employee permitted to work remotely generally 20% of the week, with the remote day to be determined by the employee and their manager and/or their department head.
Work Classifications may be changed or modified at any time by the Company.
